conclusion: Two parallel metal rails are spaced at L=0.5m, inclined at θ=30° with a magnetic field B=0.2T. Rods a and b have masses m_a=0.3kg and m_b=0.1kg, resistance R=0.1Ω, and are released from rest. A force F=2N is applied to rod a. Gravitational acceleration is g=10m/s². Joule heat in rod a is Q_a=0.12J at v_a=1.0m/s.
Image shows two metal rails inclined at 30° with rods a and b placed on them. A magnetic field is directed upwards. Force F is applied to rod a.
Calculate net force on rod a: F_net = F - m_a * g = 1.7N.
Find acceleration of rod a: a_a = F_net / m_a = 5.67m/s².
Determine velocity of rod a using Joule heat: v_a = 1.0m/s.
Apply conservation of momentum: m_a * v_a + m_b * v_b = 0, solve for v_b: v_b = -3.0m/s.
The speed magnitude of rod b is |v_b| = 3.0m/s.
